alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Madison (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Outflow winds preceding approaching strong thunderstorms are entering the area from the northwest... At 1027 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking outflow winds preceeding strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Franklin to 6 miles southwest of Calvert to 8 miles east of Rockdale to 8 miles east of Elgin to Austin. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. These winds are occurring well in advance of thunderstorms, and will not be accompanied by rain or lightning. These storms may still impact the area later in the night. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northwestern College Station, Bryan, Caldwell, Snook, Kurten, Wixon Valley, Kyle Field, Bryan Utilities Lake, Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway, Lyons, Deanville, Chriesman and North Zulch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
